meaningMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>zero</kanji>, but the verb vocab version means <vocabulary>to spill something</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to drop something</vocabulary>. Think of it this way, if you spill something, eventually it will reach <kanji>zero</kanji>.
readingMnemonic: Imagine you're <reading>co-bo</reading>iling (こぼ) water with someone. With the two of you co-boiling, the water is boiling pretty hard. Watch out, though — you're about <reading>to spill</reading> the hot water everywhere!
